title: Revisit the Ionian-Noxian War
body:
One of the hallmark stories of League of Legends was the war between Noxus and Ionia. The implications of the battles won reverberated throughout the lore, and so many characters have their background in the war. The thing is, things have changed. There is no Institute of War anymore. Battles may still be fought on the Rift, but their importance is unclear, and their effect on the lore seems to lack any connection.
There are so many story lines to weave together. From Lee Sin, Master Yi, Karma, and Irelia rising to become great warriors and leaders, to the impact of the celestial forces made by Bard and Soraka, the rise of the Kinkou Order with Kennen, Shen, and Akali,  the fall of the order at the hands of Zed, the corruption of Varus, the ascendance of Syndra, the training of Wukong in the ways of Wuju, the subduing of Udyr's primal rage, and the dishonoring of Yasuo. Even the effects on the Noxians are palpable: Riven revoking her allegiance to Noxus in hopes of finding a way to bring Noxus back into power, Swain's grand schemes that led to the start of the war, with his lapdog Darius, and Singed's villainy being realized in his ruthless use of chemical warfare. 
The story has such a large and profound impact on Runeterra, and now that much of what was carried out within the war no longer has that glue that was the Institute of War, we are left with a smattering of stories with no real cohesive means to an ending. Thus, I ask for a revisiting of the main story of the war. Maybe it continues to this day, maybe it ends at some point. The potential for this being the next long-term story arc, like Burning Tides + 2015 Harrowing, goes on and on. A whole years worth of story could be told about this war, maybe even more. Either way, I would be personally excited about a new story, and new twists on the Ionian-Noxian War.

But with everything they have to cover now and how slow these event get pushed out, I don't see Ionia getting an update anytime soon.

I think the thing I am most interested in, above all else, is to see how the characters interact with this new manner in which they divulge lore. The way they actively settled Graves' and Twisted Fate's lore, kicked up Miss Fortune's effectiveness and deposed of Gangplank, all the while setting up for the Harrowing, even giving Olaf a brief cameo, and then setting up Illaoi's release, this was the most interactive and enjoyable developments of lore I have ever seen.
Imagine, a settling of Yasuo's search as he confronts Riven, or a twist in Syndra's story where she becomes the greatest traitor in Ionia's cause, siding with Noxus in an effort to gain increased autonomy and freedom, or how Soraka, who was largely not mention in the original war storyline, is the major proponent of non-violence, while the 4 Heros of Ionia, Lee Sin, Karma, Irelia, and Master Yi choose the middle ground between peace and violence. Think also of the effects the corruption has on Varus. Does it spread out from his influence and affect those around them, forcing him to live alone as a hermit? Where do these champions belong? These are the quiestions I ask.

There's a part of me that envisions the Ionian-Noxus War as having happened years ago, decades; far back enough that some still remember the fires and smoke, but long enough that a generation has grown with it as a fact of life. Peacetalks concluded that Noxus would hold a province they had captured as a vassal colony, but would cease further aggression. The reason I bring that up is because I also imagined loyal Noxian citizens, even if they have to be children, living their entire lives in Ionia. There's something about it that appeals to me. I don't know how Ionia would've brought Noxus to the table, and I know this would clash horribly with Riven and Yasuo's lore, etc. But I had the thought nonetheless.
